articles.description: Amadou Onana's header lifts Everton out of the Premier League's bottom three as they rescue a point against Crystal Palace at Goodison Park.
articles.title: Onana header earns Everton point against Palace

articles.description: As Oliver Glasner is named Crystal Palace manager, BBC Sport looks at the Austrian with a "genuine talent for revitalising sides" and "intensity akin to Jurgen Klopp".
articles.title: Glasner - the new Palace boss with an 'intensity akin to Klopp'

articles.description: Napoli sack manager Walter Mazzarri after just three months in charge and replace him Slovakia boss Francesco Calzona.
articles.title: Napoli sack manager Mazzarri and appoint Calzona

articles.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?
articles.title: Who has a new hero? Garth Crooks' Team of the Week

articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola apologises to Kalvin Phillips for saying the midfielder was "overweight" on his return from the Qatar World Cup.
articles.title: Guardiola apologises to Phillips for weight comment

articles.description: Coach Brendon McCullum says England are "hurting" after a 434-run defeat by India in the third Test, but have "no regrets".
articles.title: England 'hurting' after Rajkot defeat - McCullum

articles.description: Josh Kerr and Laura Muir are named in the Great Britain and Northern Ireland team for March's World Athletics Indoor Championships in Glasgow.
articles.title: World Athletics Indoor Championships: Josh Kerr and Laura Muir named in Great Britain squad

articles.description: Roy Hodgson's nomadic 48-year career in management took him around the world but has surely ended at the place he called home - Crystal Palace.
articles.title: 'A season too far - time for Hodgson to hang up tracksuit'

articles.description: Newcastle United's sporting director Dan Ashworth is placed on gardening leave after telling the club he wants to join Manchester United.
articles.title: Ashworth on gardening leave amid Man Utd interest

articles.description: British number one Cameron Norrie opens his defence of the ATP Rio title with a routine victory over Hugo Dellien.
articles.title: ATP Rio Open: Briton Cameron Norrie beats Hugo Dellien
